But conventional thinking is the wrong way to judge unconventional actions.   2.)  US economic policy has been so mindlessly conventional-- for So Long!-- that ANY move away from the Same Old Shit-- will have at-least a momentary "Change Dividend".     For example, taking the flippers off your feet & using them to paddle with your hands is-- in general-- a bad idea.  EXCEPT, if you've been using only your legs to swim 50 miles... then, yeah, your legs are probably exhausted & your arms Will Be better (temporarily).    That applies to things like Tariffs.   I think they're good.  I may be wrong.  But the US has been SO anti-tariff... for So Long... that switching to tariffs provides Short Term relief.  EVEN IF tariffs are (perhaps) bad policy In The Long Run.
